author: Ryan Daws
description:
The npm registry is once again in the spotlight, this time battling a malware campaign using malicious packages to map developer networks. Expert threat intelligence analysts over at Socket have flagged a coordinated attack involving at least three publisher accounts. These aren’t your run-of-the-mill malicious efforts; these actors have managed to distribute 60 different packages,... Read more »

The post 60 malicious npm packages caught mapping developer networks appeared first on Developer Tech News.
title: 60 malicious npm packages caught mapping developer networks
